body: @Chuckthebear All the stocks are crashing, you fool. According to your logic, $MSFT , $AAPL, $AMZN and $GOOG are worthless stocks too.

$AAPL I remember when Apple hit $700 and then went hard down. Bears 🐻 were saying it will never see ATH again and it was overvalued 😂😂😂
Hmm, since then, it split twice and the current ATH from 2 weeks ago in prices before the splits was at $5,145. 
Now I hear the same silly bears that are posting the same crap 💩😂😂😂

$AAPL 63 of 100 StockTwits member requested charts in 60 minutes and in no particular order.  No notes on charts, because the goal is not to lead you to a bullish or bearish consensus, but to stimulate a technical conversation. 
My comments and charts should NOT be construed as trading or investment advice.  I am not licensed to give trading, investment, or any kind of financial advice. Seek competent licensed counsel before putting money to work in the markets. It's your money, so be careful with it. 
Feel free to comment on as many charts as you would like, but from here on out I'll only be counting the number of "LIKES" a chart receives towards it's eligibility to be part of the 100 next week.  The charts that get the fewest "likes" I'll have to assume nobody cares about.  Those tickers will run the risk of being left off of the 100 charts in 60 minutes next week. If you want to see the whole list of tickers and in order visit my Stocktwits profile page and scroll to the beginning
$AAPL ..Rating Reiterated by Citigroup  today to $200 …. https://www.tickerreport.com/banking-finance/8351699/apple-nasdaqaapl-rating-reiterated-by-citigroup.html

links.title: Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) Rating Reiterated by Citigroup
links.description: Citigroup restated their buy rating on shares of Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) in a research report report published on Wednesday morning, Stock Target Advisor reports. They currently have a $200.00 target price on the iPhone maker's stock. A number of other equities analysts have also commented on the stock.

links.title: The Nasdaq Composite is down 11% so far in 2022 and poised for worst start to a year since the 2008 financial crisis
links.description: To say it has been a rough start for the technology-heavy Nasdaq Composite Index may be the understatement of the young year. Check out: Stock-market warning signal: Here's what surging bond yields say about S&P 500 returns in next 6 months The Nasdaq Composite was off about 11% on Friday since the start of 2022, at last check, marking a double-digit decline in the year's first 14 sessions.

links.title: Apple Stock Gets a Big Target Price Boost Ahead of Earnings. Here's Why.
links.description: Tech stocks were getting hammered again Friday, but there was good news on the radar for Apple. Wells Fargo raised its price target for Apple (ticker: AAPL) stock to $205 a share from $165 - implying some 25% upside from Thursday's closing levels.

body: $AAPL next week could see $8-12 bounce straight up in a 2 hour period. It will lack a significant pull back. Sell when it becomes very overextended. Stop out remainder on first large red bar and short back to new lows and then some. DO NOT BUY DIP ON THAT BOUNCE. When it’s done it’s done.

$AAPL seems to holding up well. Needs to if the $QQQ is going to hold the 50W moving avg.
